questions.question: Define relative atomic mass.
questions.answer: The weighted mean mass of an atom of an element compared with one-twelfth of the mass of an atom of carbon-12.

questions.question: Describe how ions are produced in a time-of-flight mass spectrometer.
questions.answer: Sample is bombarded by high-energy electrons which knock out electrons to form positive ions.

questions.question: Explain why isotopes of the same element have the same chemical properties.
questions.answer: They have the same electron configuration.

questions.question: State the trend in first ionisation energy across Period 3.
questions.answer: General increase due to increasing nuclear charge with similar shielding.

questions.question: Explain why the first ionisation energy of aluminium is lower than that of magnesium.
questions.answer: Aluminium has its outer electron in the 3p subshell which is higher in energy than the 3s subshell in magnesium.

questions.question: Explain why sulfur has a lower first ionisation energy than phosphorus.
questions.answer: Paired electrons in a 3p orbital in sulfur repel each other, reducing the energy needed to remove one.
